sfextras 0.1.0
  • Reference

Perform a buffer operation on a temporary projected CRS

geo_buffer.Rd

This function solves the problem that buffers will not be circular when used on non-projected data.

geo_buffer(shp, dist = NULL, ...)

Arguments

shp

A spatial object with a geographic CRS (e.g. WGS84) around which a buffer should be drawn
dist

The distance (in metres) of the buffer (when buffering simple features)
...

Arguments passed to the buffer (see `?rgeos::gBuffer` or `?sf::st_buffer` for details)

Details

Requires recent version of PROJ (>= 6.3.0). Buffers on `sf` objects with geographic (lon/lat) coordinates can also be done with the [`s2`](https://r-spatial.github.io/s2/) package.

Examples

lib_versions <- sf::sf_extSoftVersion()
lib_versions

#>           GEOS           GDAL         proj.4 GDAL_with_GEOS     USE_PROJ_H 
#>        "3.8.0"        "3.0.4"        "6.3.1"         "true"         "true" 
nc = sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package="sf"))

#> Reading layer `nc' from data source `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/sf/shape/nc.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
#> Simple feature collection with 100 features and 14 fields
#> geometry type:  MULTIPOLYGON
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: -84.32385 ymin: 33.88199 xmax: -75.45698 ymax: 36.58965
#> geographic CRS: NAD27
if (lib_versions[3] >= "6.3.1") {
  buff_sf <- geo_buffer(nc, dist = 50)
  plot(buff_sf$geometry)
  geo_buffer(nc$geometry, dist = 50)
  # on legacy sp objects (not tested)
  # buff_sp <- geo_buffer(routes_fast, width = 100)
  # class(buff_sp)
  # plot(buff_sp, col = "red")
}

#> Geometry set for 100 features 
#> geometry type:  GEOMETRY
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: -84.3244 ymin: 33.88154 xmax: -75.45643 ymax: 36.5901
#> geographic CRS: NAD27
#> First 5 geometries:
#> POLYGON ((-81.47258 36.23393, -81.47261 36.2339...
#> POLYGON ((-81.2395 36.36504, -81.23952 36.36503...
#> POLYGON ((-80.4558 36.24248, -80.4558 36.24245,...
#> MULTIPOLYGON (((-75.90252 36.55607, -75.90253 3...
#> POLYGON ((-77.21714 36.24083, -77.21715 36.2408...
